questions.question_text: When auditing the feasibility study of a system development project, the IS auditor should:

choices.A: review the request for proposal (RFP) to ensure that it covers the scope of work.
choices.B: ensure that vendor contracts are reviewed by legal counsel.
choices.D: review qualifications of key members of the project team.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Reviewing the cost-benefit documentation done by unqualified members will lead to wrong decision making my friend. First, review qualifications of key members of the project team.

Selected Answer: C
The feasibility study typically includes an analysis of the costs and benefits associated with the proposed system development. The IS auditor should review the cost-benefit documentation to ensure that it is reasonable, accurate, and provides a sound basis for decision-making. This involves assessing the validity of cost estimates, evaluating projected benefits, and ensuring that the financial analysis aligns with industry standards and organizational goals.

comments.content:
C. Review cost-benefit documentation for reasonableness:
This is a critical part of auditing a feasibility study. The IS auditor should assess whether the projected costs and benefits outlined in the study are reasonable and have been adequately justified. This is essential for determining the project's economic feasibility.

D. Review qualifications of key members of the project team:
Assessing the qualifications of key team members is important to ensure that they have the necessary expertise and experience to successfully execute the project. This is especially relevant in evaluating the project's technical feasibility.

A. Review the request for proposal (RFP) to ensure that it covers the scope of work:
This is important because it ensures that the RFP accurately reflects the project's scope and requirements. Ensuring that the RFP is comprehensive and aligned with the feasibility study is a key part of the audit.

B. Ensure that vendor contracts are reviewed by legal counsel:
This is also crucial to ensure that the contracts are legally sound and protect the interests of the organization. While it may not be part of the feasibility study itself, reviewing contracts is an important part of project management and risk assessment.

discussion.content: In summary, all of these options are important considerations when auditing the feasibility study of a system development project. The choice of which one is the most critical may depend on the specific context of the project and the auditor's objectives, but each option plays a significant role in assessing the project's feasibility and mitigating risks

questions.question_text: Transaction records from a business database were inadvertently deleted, and system operators decided to restore from a snapshot copy. Which of the following provides the BEST assurance that the transactions were recovered successfully?

choices.C: Rerun the process on a backup machine to verify the results are the same.
choices.B: Compare transaction values against external statements to verify accuracy.
choices.D: Review transaction recovery logs to ensure no errors were recorded.
choices.A: Recount the transaction records to ensure no records are missing.

discussion.content:
After reconsidering option D, it's clear that while reviewing transaction recovery logs ensures that the recovery process did not encounter errors, it does not directly confirm the accuracy or completeness of the recovered transaction data. Therefore, the best assurance still lies with:

B. Compare transaction values against external statements to verify accuracy

Selected Answer: D
Transaction recovery logs typically provide a detailed record of the recovery process, including any errors or issues encountered during the restoration. By reviewing these logs, one can ensure that the recovery process was completed without errors and that all transactions were successfully restored.
